identificationModule.briefTitle: Care Navigator Support for Younger Latinx Adults With Type 2 Diabetes
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized Trial of Care Navigator to Support Younger Latinx Adults Newly Diagnosed With Type 2 Diabetes (AURORA)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study proposes to rigorously evaluate a proactive, culturally responsive care navigator intervention targeting younger-onset Latinx individuals with a new T2D diagnosis (AURORA \[Active Outreach to Younger Latinx\]) within Kaiser Permanente Northern California (KPNC).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study has three primary objectives: 1) learn what is required to create and sustain a care navigator workforce and document our experience hiring a care navigator for the study, 2) implement and evaluate the AURORA strategy within KPNC, and 3) refine and adapt the AURORA strategy for future Kaiser Permanente (KP) wide dissemination. The AURORA strategy centers on a care navigator who will proactively conduct three telemedicine visits tailored to Latinx adults with early onset type 2 diabetes (T2D, defined as age \<45 years). The AURORA strategy will conducted with the following five goals: 1) assessment of familiarity and use of T2D care within KP, 2) assessment of individual's self-management support needs, 3) motivational interviewing to support behavior change, 4) pragmatic skills training, including use of crucial technologies to support self-management, and 5) matching member's needs with existing KPNC T2D resources.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: The study team will conduct a patient-level randomized, parallel-group pragmatic trial of usual care vs. the AURORA care strategy among Latinx members (ages 18-44), recently diagnosed with T2D with a diagnosis HbA1c ≥8% (n=102/study arm). Outcomes assessed at 6 months post-enrollment will include HbA1c changes, medication initiation and adherence, and changes in patient-reported measures (e.g., self-efficacy).

armGroups.label: AURORA Care Strategy
armGroups.description: Participants will receive the AURORA Care Strategy in addition to their usual diabetes care.

armGroups.label: Usual Care
armGroups.description: No intervention will be employed. This arm will continue to receive their usual diabetes care.

interventions.name: AURORA Care Strategy
interventions.description: Participants will be invited to partake in three telemedicine visits with the care navigator during the months following diagnosis. The visits center around proactive and tailored T2D self-management support.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Differences between study arms in HbA1c change 6-months following enrollment
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in HbA1c will be assessed using HbA1c values obtained through routine care, with the most recent HbA1c preceding study enrollment and the HbA1c value closest to 6-months following enrollment used to assess HbA1c change.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences in healthcare contact with members of the T2D diabetes care team, including care manager, PCPs, educators.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Use of remote glucose monitoring to measure glucose levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Use of a remote glucose monitoring to measure glucose levels

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant-reported measures: Confidence in Accessing Care
Participant-reported measures: Motivation and locus of control

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* KPNC member, age \>20 and age \<45 with
* New clinical diagnosis of T2D within the prior 1-8 months
* HbA1c≥8%. If the study team are having trouble recruiting an adequate sample, the study team may lower the HbA1c threshold to ≥7.5%
* Proficient (written and spoken) in English or Spanish

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant women
* Type 1 Diabetes
